page.title: 04THE LIBRARY, WITHAM.
page.content: The Library is in Newland St. It moved there from Maldon Rd. in 1981 because the old building was too small . They have 66,850 books!It is housed in a 200 yr old house that at one time was a Post office,then a school.In 1925 it was changed into a cinema ,now it is a library.It is very attractive. The front is Georgian and inside it is modern because they didn't want to change the outside. As well as books they have videos and records. They will put up posters in the entrance hall. Down stairs there are childrens books and fiction books. There aretables to sit and read at.In the holiday they have Book Train for children who like reading so they can enter competitions.Upstairs are the local directories and other reference books.They use light pens that they pass over the ticket and the book.
